question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Cross-function: Multiple is_* functions] [Mutual exclusion] Can an account identifier be classified as multiple types simultaneously (e.g., both is_active_stake() and is_total_stake()), causing logic errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Cross-function: Delegated constructors & is_delegator_*] [Validation gap] Do the is_delegator_* functions properly validate that metadata.pool_address matches what the delegated constructors would create? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: AccountIdentifier] [Malformed JSON] Can attackers send JSON with extra fields that serde ignores but could cause issues in downstream processing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: AccountIdentifier] [Null injection] What happens if address field is empty string or contains null bytes - does deserialization succeed but later validation fail? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: SubAccountIdentifier] [Type confusion] Can attackers deserialize SubAccountIdentifier with address set to arbitrary values not matching any constant (STAKE, ACTIVE_STAKE, etc.)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: SubAccountIdentifier] [Metadata injection] Can attackers add metadata to sub-accounts that shouldn't have it (like commission or rewards), causing classification errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: BlockIdentifier] [Index/hash mismatch] Can attackers deserialize BlockIdentifier where the hash doesn't match the expected 'chain_id-index' format for that index? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: NetworkIdentifier] [Blockchain spoofing] Can attackers set blockchain field to values other than 'aptos' and still have operations succeed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: NetworkIdentifier] [Network tampering] Can attackers provide network values that don't correspond to valid ChainIds but still deserialize successfully? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: OperationIdentifier] [Negative index] While index is u64, can underflow in arithmetic operations with index cause it to wrap to large values? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: PartialBlockIdentifier] [Both fields set] Can attackers deserialize PartialBlockIdentifier with both index and hash set, violating the 'should not be provided at same time' constraint? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Deserialization: TransactionIdentifier] [Hash format manipulation] Can attackers provide transaction hash in non-lowercase hex, and would it still match or cause lookup failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Constant: STAKE] [Constant tampering] Is the STAKE constant ('stake') properly protected from modification, or could build-time attacks change it? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Constant: ACCOUNT_SEPARATOR] [Separator in addresses] If an operator's hex address naturally contains the '-' character from hex encoding, does this break operator_address() parsing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Constant: All stake type constants] [Collision risk] Are all the stake type constants (STAKE, PENDING_ACTIVE_STAKE, etc.) guaranteed to be unique and not collide with possible hex addresses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Integration: Rosetta API] [API compliance] Does the implementation fully comply with Rosetta API spec, or could deviations cause interoperability issues with Rosetta tools? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Integration: to_hex_lower()] [Hex encoding] The to_hex_lower() function is called extensively - can it produce non-standard hex that causes issues with other hex parsers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Integration: AccountAddress::from_str()] [Version compatibility] Are all versions of AccountAddress::from_str() compatible, or could upgrades break existing identifier parsing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Edge case: Empty address] [Empty string handling] What happens if AccountIdentifier.address is empty string - does account_address() properly reject it? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Edge case: Maximum stake types] [State explosion] With many stake types (total, active, pending_active, inactive, pending_inactive, operator, delegated variants, commission, rewards), can attackers create combinatorial explosion of queries? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Edge case: Unicode addresses] [Unicode injection] Can attackers include Unicode characters in address strings that appear similar to valid hex but cause parsing issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Edge case: Very long addresses] [Length limits] Is there a maximum length for address strings, or can attackers provide extremely long strings causing memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Edge case: Case mixing] [Case sensitivity] Can attackers mix uppercase and lowercase in hex addresses (0xAbCd) to create multiple representations of same address? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Edge case: Special addresses] [Reserved addresses] Are special addresses like 0x0, 0x1 properly validated in AccountIdentifier, or could operations on system accounts be exploited? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/types/identifiers.rs] [Staking: Operator stake] [Operator authorization] When creating operator_stake_account(), is there validation that the caller is authorized to query that operator's stake? (High)
